    populateTownGraph(File file)
    Creates a graph based on the information read from a file The information must be in this format: road-name,miles;town-name; town-name For example: I-94,282;Chicago;Detroit

    • getRoad

      public String getRoad(String town1, String town2)
      Returns the name of the road that both towns are connected through
      Specified by:
      getRoad in interface TownGraphManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      town1 - name of town 1 (lastname, firstname)
      town2 - name of town 2 (lastname, firstname)
      Returns:
      name of road if town 1 and town2 are in the same road, returns null if not

    • getPath

      public ArrayList<String> getPath(String town1, String town2)
      Returns the shortest path from town 1 to town 2
      Specified by:
      getPath in interface TownGraphManagerInterface
      Parameters:
      town1 - name of town 1 (lastname, firstname)
      town2 - name of town 2 (lastname, firstname)
      Returns:
      an Arraylist of roads connecting the two towns together, null if the towns have no path to connect them.

    • populateTownGraph

      public void populateTownGraph(File file) throws IOException
      Creates a graph based on the information read from a file The information must be in this format: road-name,miles;town-name; town-name For example: I-94,282;Chicago;Detroit
      Parameters:
      file -
      Throws:
      IOException
